Transcript
T-Rex: Sherlock Holmes, the world's greatest non-bat-themed public-domain detective, had a new case. And his client...

T-Rex: ...was HERCULES.

T-Rex: Sherlock quickly deduced that Hercules had the strength of ten ordinary men, which was strong, but it wasn't like - BENDING STEEL strong. He was nowhere NEAR Superman.
Dromiceiomimus: Strength inflation had really done a number on ol' Herc since ancient Greek times, huh?
T-Rex: It totally has!

Utahraptor: So what was Hercules's case?
T-Rex: He kept getting beat up by eleven guys!

T-Rex: And honestly that was already overkill. Even TEN guys could beat up Hercules no problem, since they have equal strength but 36 extra limbs to punch and kick with. Sherlock deduced he'd need to talk to these guys to see if they'd stop beating up his client Hercules!

Off panel: How does the story end?
T-Rex: DUDE!
T-Rex: Sherlock Holmes gets beat up by eleven guys!!
What are the haps my friends


March 15th, 2024: I am not making up these Hercules facts!! I can quote sources and everything. (Also, looking at that cartoon as an adult, they TOTALLY just put Superman in a toga and a wrestling belt for Hercules's character design and called it a day.)

UPDATE: I have been informed (thank you Simon, Jay, and Eric!) that Sherlock Holmes DOES bend steel?? As per "The Adventure of the Speckled Band":

He stepped swiftly forward, seized the poker, and bent it into a curve with his huge brown hands.

"See that you keep yourself out of my grip," he snarled, and hurling the twisted poker into the fireplace, he strode out of the room.

"He seems a very amiable person," said Holmes, laughing. "I am not quite so bulky, but if he had remained I might have shown him that my grip was not much more feeble than his own." As he spoke he picked up the steel poker, and with a sudden effort straightened it out again.

So there you have it! Sherlock Holmes had secret Superman superpowers all along :0

One year ago today: on a long enough timescale, timescales get unreasonably long

– Ryan
